headline: Gnocchi
description: Gnocchi is easy to make with just three easy ingredients: mashed potato, flour and an egg ‚Äî that's all you need to knead for gnocchi!

video.description: See how to make amazing potato gnocchi.
video.name: Gnocchi I

name: Gnocchi

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil; add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes. Drain, cool, and mash with a fork or potato masher.

Combine 1 cup mashed potato, flour, and egg in a large bowl. Knead until dough forms a ball. Shape small portions of the dough into long "snakes". On a floured surface, cut snakes into 1/2-inch pieces.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Drop in gnocchi and cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until gnocchi have risen to the top; drain and serve.

review.reviewBody: Receipt was perfect! Hardiest part was rolling it out in string lengths but got it and would do it again! Thanks!
I really enjoyed the recipe, the gnocchi came out Just right as I used I bit less flour that was called for.
Not easy to make. The dough was much too dry, it needed an additional egg and a handful more of mashed potatoes. Requires more ingredients than what is listed.
Great Used the KitchenAid dough hook to blend Thanks!

Beautiful, takes a little grease of the elbow to mix it through. One egg is plenty. Home grown potatoes, pasta sauce from garden tomatoes, herbs also from the garden, and an egg from the chicken. Wonderful fresh and tasty! So little ingredients so much gnocchi!!

Simple and fabulous! I served these with homemade marinara sauce with green pepper. I like to cook, so I was able to master this recipe at the first try. But it takes a lot of intuition; if you're not willing to cook "by feel," you will be frustrated trying to make these.
Love this recipe, I‚Äôd 100% make it again‚Ä¶.
Inedible. What a waste of potato and egg.
I‚Äôve used this recipe many times and it works great.
Bagus
It had no flavor and was stiff and doughy. I think it needs more potatoes than flour!!!!!!
1 egg was not enough, the dough was too dry, adding another egg was needed.
It came out beautifully!!
They turned out perfect!
Love this recipe!!! Just make sure you knead until smooth ball. They are delish !!
This was quick and easy. I made it even easier by using potato flakes and instead of fresh potatoes.
Very easy to make! I used bake potatoes because it is what is traditionally used. Thank you for this recipe. I made a quick tomato sauce üòã

Love fresh gnocchi. I also made this recipe with 1cup of pur√©ed left over butternut squash. Just added a little extra flour so the dough was less sticky. Served it with brown butter and sage sauce. Yummy
I made this with leftover mashed potatoes. Turned out fantastic!
The potato boiling time was incorrect, when I strained my potato‚Äôs they were still firm.

Read the comments before making these. There are a lot of helpful tips that ensure a good result. Mine came out great after following the tips in the comments (eg don't add all the flour at once, only add enough flour to form a dough that you can handle). I think my dough was a bit wet still because it was difficult to shape the pillows so I followed another recommendation which was to use a plastic bag with the corner cut off to make the pillows. I cooked them in batches and they came out light and fluffy and delicious (I seasoned with salt and a bit of herbs).

I made this for another recipe and it turned out really well! It is quite a simple pasta I rolled the pastas on a fork to give them their signature shape. I did find I needed quite a but of flour but don‚Äôt add all two cups at once. Add it in slowly because, as another review said, depending on the way you cooked your potatoes (boiled cut up, boiled whole) they will absorb different amounts of water. Good luck!
Followed recipe exactly and it was a bit dense. Next time will take suggestions of other reviewers and mix egg and potato together first, then add just as much flour as needed (about a cup).

Hello all, so two-theee things, first is bake your potatoes in the oven, yes it takes longer but your potatoes stay dry which means you can use less flour. A food mill is the best bet for getting nice pillow like gnocchi . When boiling your gnocchi make sure it‚Äôs a rolling boil, remove after they float and immediately into a ice bath, once cool dry on tri folds towels or a microfiber towel. I prefer egg yolks to whole eggs but to each their own. I make 40# of potatoes of gnocchi Tuesday through Sunday. A pastry bag and a scissors work well for consistency and ease.
The ratio of potato, flour, and egg is the key. These were light and airy. Thanks!
if you're scaling up the recipe, make sure you cook the potatoes longer and use a little bit less flour
If you want a lighter gnocchi, try using ricotta cheese instead of potato. Or 1/2 cup potato and 1/2 cup of ricotta. The less you handle the dough the lighter and softer the gnocchi.
its easy
Really easy and fun to make!
My first attempt at making gnocchi. It tastes some good! Easy recipe. Well worth the effort.
I should have looked at the reviews first, this dish came out mealy for me too. Just not enough instructions here. I recommend using a different guide.
Simple and delicious
Was very excited about this recipe and it turned out a failure. Followed the gnocchi recipe to a T. The gnocchi had no flavor. Definitely not making this again.
Extra egg
Watched my Italian Noni make these for years....always held my breath when making the potatoes.....what I do now... is use Russet potatoes and microwave the potatoes.

Recipe was good, but too much flour. Unfortunately I put all of the ingredients in a bowl right away and had to add another egg to be able to mix it together. Next time I will start with 1 cup of flour.
The recipe makes lots of gnocchi!
i used 1/2 the mount of flour. next time crack pepper in the dough

The only reason this didn't get five stars from me was because it didn't work as written (I should have read the reviews first for tips, as I usually do). 

I cooked the two potatoes in my pressure cooker, riced them, and added one cup of the riced potatoes to my stand mixer, with an egg and two cups of flour as the recipe called for, using my dough hook to knead. The dough was far too dry and crumbly, and I was worried that adding another egg would make it too wet. I ended up adding three tablespoons of water, one at a time. That was getting it close to the desired consistency. I wondered if a teeny bit of olive oil would help, so I added a teaspoon. Within seconds, the dough was perfect. I rolled each rope lightly in flour so I could feed it through my cavatelli maker without the finished pieces sticking, and it was perfection.

First time trying gnocchi and I think the effort could use some refining because they were on the chewier, denser side. I prefer my gnocchi pillowy and soft. The (russet) potatoes were maybe a bit larger than average and took longer to cook. Even at 20 minutes, when I stopped boiling, they didn‚Äôt mash too easily, so I think the larger potatoes will generally take about 25 minutes. I also probably made the gnocchi a bit too big, maybe around an inch rather than a half inch. If I tried this recipe again, I would also probably use 1 or 1.5 cups flour rather than 2.Served this with a brown butter sage sauce, which was nice.
pretty easy. made a garlic cream sauce. delicious
Very simple recipe and I made it vegan by using an egg substitute. I used a cashew sauce on top of it. Very good

Loved this! Made a double batch and froze half for a quick dinner another night. Served with a garlic butter sauce. Everyone loved it. Very filling and a bit chewy but from what I read I shouldn‚Äôt have kneaded for as long as I did. I used less flour than directed, adding in 1 cup the the rest in 1/4 cup increments as needed. Will make again!

Great starter recipe! Remember: kneed less than you think! I used about half a cup less flour than needed and just used some extra to flower my work surface. But the second it forms and is mixed, cut them. This way they are lighter/fluffier. Also: be sure to flour them once they are made as to make sure they do not stick together.

I made it with my favorite pesto sauce- with the pesto it was good- without it was kind of completely bland. I would also recommend cooking the potatoes for 22-25 minutes as they are much easier to mash if you do that.
After cooking they tasted like... flour. Followed the recipe exactly. Way too much flour to potato ratio for my taste.
Its and not fluffy i made it for my family and they all disliked it and were dissatisfied with the result.

good, simple meal.

one problem I have with the video is the statement "save the extra potatos for another use".

what do you do with left over potato's? you make gnocchi!

use all of your potato to make gnocchi the first time. save steps, mess, clean up ti.e, etc.

make adjustments to other ingredients if needed,
The recipe was good, but the dough did have potato chunks in the finished dough, which made it a little tedious to take out before boiling it. Delicious recipe though!

Delicious! My girls and I made gnocchi for the first time and this recipe was easy and pretty quick. I doubled the potatoes and used apx. 3 cups of flour. I threw some garlic powder and salt into the potatoes after mashing. I didn't have any issue with too much water in the potatoes after boiling. I'm so glad I made this and its definitely getting adding to the regular menu. The whole family loved it!
Followed the recipe to the T , what I made were rock hard pieces of cooked dough. The proportions are wrong! Watch out!
Had to add a little bit of water to help the dough come together
Very good, appreciated Everywhere's (2-20-06) review and hint about the flour.
very forgiving. We didn't mash the potatoes up quite enough, but it all worked out when we boiled the Gnocchi.

Flavor was very good but dough was heavy compared to what I‚Äôm used to. I used a fork instead of my potato ricer...flavor was great so I will try it again, using the ricer. The ratio listed left my dough too dry so I added an extra egg and that seemed to help. I doubled the recipe and it was enough for 3 people for 3 days.
super easy and yummy!

Delish!!! I halved the potatoes when boiling and so only used about 1.5 cups of flour (however I used 2 large russet potatoes and it made 2 batches). I started kneading by hand and it was very difficult until I used a mechanical mixer w/ a dough hook but after that it was great! The pasta came out soft and yummy. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better first gnocchi recipe! Will be making it again!
After boiling, my husband and I thought it might be nice with a bit of crisp, so we pan-fried them in butter until they were lightly golden. Beautiful! Definitely a new favourite of ours!
no changes, it was awesome
Love it
I followed the recipe but it was extremely dry, so I just added a bit of water and olive oil. Fixed it really well, plus I added some basil and garlic powder. They were great after that!
The recipe was easy. Reading all the comments helped me a lot. The gnocchi turned out perfectly. Definitely will do this again

Fantastic, easy recipe for delicious pasta! Tricky getting the potatoes mashed into a flour, but excellent. I now add two tablespoons of shredded parmesan. My kids love these with red sauce or Alfredo. Also fantastic in soup.
Great recipe! I blended the egg and the cup of potatoes to avoid chunks. I worked every well.
Great

I loved this gnocchi recipe. It simplifies the recipe instead of adding a sauce filling to the gnocchi, incorporating the potatoes into the pasta. I added some basic savory spices (thyme, basil, salt, pepper, pinch of garlic powder) to the pasta as well to add some extra flavor. My dough was a little dry, so I added an a couple tablespoons of water, which made the dough more pliable. I also pan-seared the gnocchi after boiling it until there was about of brown crust on the outside. I seared the gnocchi in olive oil, butter, and basic savory spices adding extra flavor. I wanted to preserve the flavor, so I just tossed my pasta in Parmesan cheese.
Good basic recipe. It would be helpful if the potatoes were measured in pounds. We used 2 lbs. of white potatoes (about 5 medium), and it took a lot more flour than 2C.

This recipe is a great place to start! I oven bake my potatoes and then peel them. Since there‚Äôs not extra moisture added, I only need 1 1/2 cups flour. I also recommend adding at least 1 tsp of salt.

Simple recipe to follow. A couple of things here though, 2 potatoes is pretty vague since potatoes greatly vary in sizes. You may have to pay with the amount of flour because of that. Also, if you bake the potatoes, they give you a much drier potato and will result in a lighter end product. I also like to use a potato ricer while the potatoes are still warm to ensure even texture. These are great though! My first batch was really misshapen so I bought a gnocchi paddle for $5 and then next time they were perfect. Definitely a must try if you like gnocchi! Nothing beats homemade.

The perfect recipe!!! Super easy to follow as well. Main thing to watch for is that your potatoes are cooked all the way If you can stick a knife through them easily they‚Äôre done! . After mashing them if they seem a little dry try adding the tiniest bit of water that in turn keeps your dough from being dry and crumbly. Also knead the heck out of the dough until smooth and springy . 

I also cut my gnocchis smaller. The ones shown were too big for my taste and it made it easier to roll them out on a fork .

This is the second time I have made gnocchi. First time was crazy! So I read a lot of reviews this time. I found a lot of the reviews talk about the moisture in potatoes. So I boiled the potatoes in large pieces some whole. I tried to have potatoes about same size and did not over cook. Took them off when they were soft not mushy.Once done I ran potatoes under cold water. I used a ricer. I added an egg to potatoes and added flour a little at a time and worked it in with my hand.It is such a great feeling when you get to the right constancy. Took a handful of dough rolled so it looked like a snake and cut in pieces. Wasn‚Äôt sure some people saying roll on fork. No idea what they are talking about. Next time I will try to be more consistent with the size use a fork and press down on rolls and the pieces the same size. Like recipe boiled dough until it went to top. I had taken olive oil and fried garlic and a bit of onions. Put gnocchi in frying pan for a few minutes I used fine herbs. Delicious!
Easy to make and turned out beautifully. I made a nice sausage/tomato sauce and added some mozzarella for a very tasty casserole. Yummy!
Truly awful recipe. Don't waste your time. I threw mine out. The proportion to potato and flour are all wrong!

I didn‚Äôt use the full two cups of flour(it didn‚Äôt end up needing it all) and I seasoned the dough to my personal preferences and it came out amazingly. I will definitely end up using this recipe again

It‚Äôs the basic recipe but as my Gramma taught me is you add the flour until it has the right ‚Äúfeel‚Äù not too moist and not to dry. This was one of my favorites she served and she usually only made them when her friend who was a Priest in the Vatican would visit once a year! We are a large family and I now know how much work that was and it was always an endless bowl of gnocchi. Blessed to add I now have her big pasta bowl. It takes practice so don‚Äôt give up if your first few tries aren‚Äôt perfect!
I dont know it didn't work for me I might try it again
I had to add more flour...Ijust added about 2 more cups of flour as I was kneading the dough. That's how my mom used to do it and she was born in Naples, Italy.
yum
My gnocchis came out great although next time i will make sure my potatoes are smoother!!
As a kiddo who knows nothing about potatoes, remember folks to cut them up before boiling so they boil all the way through. But overall amazing!!!!
This was a great recipe. Easy to make.
You need more potatoes than anything else. Only found that out after researching gnocchi. So a cup less flour will help this tremendously! Or add another cup to a cup and a half more potatoes

I used a potato ricer to get a nice texture and made sure to not over mix it. You also don't want to over flour it for a more tender texture. So be mindful when putting flour on your surface. As well as when you lightly flour each pillow to avoid sticking in the pan. Very easy recipe. This was my first attempt and it turned out amazing.
it was so easy. I will keep this one.
I think recipe is a bit misleading about how much flour should be used but mine turned out to be great (I used around 1.25 cups). Thanks.
Simple and delicious. :)
I couldn't get the shape down right but they tasted really good. I reccomend putting them end soup at the very end like a dumpling
Will stick to store bought. Seemed like way to much flour. All I could taste was flour not any potato.
Ratio of flour to potato is way off- like by a factor of 10. Should be closer to 32oz (1,000g) of potatoes to 6 oz of flour (200g). Or 2 large potatoes: 1/4 cup of flour.
It was so easy smashing the russet potatoes with a potato masher instead of a ricer which I did not have. They came out wonderful and I would definitely make it again
I was so easy and increasingly tasty!
I used Idahoan instant mashed potatoes to save time. The gnocchi were perfect, everyone loved them!
Never had gnocchi before and it was so easy to make and incredibly delicious. I made a spinach alfredo sauce to go with mine. Yum!
I would maybe make it again but I only gave it three stars because the flour gets everywhere and it does not taste like much. But it is very fun and kids like it.

Turned out perfect! This was my first time marking them. I always buy them from restaurants. Super easy and fresh. I did cut up my potatoes before boiling. I salted the water and the potatoes were ready in about 8 minutes in the water. I cooled them with cold water and my ratio was 2 cups of flour/ 2 cups of potato/ 1 egg. I started with 1 cup of potato and added more until the consistency felt right, without too much stickiness. We made a butter,garlic,mushroom,spinach sauce that turned out great.

This recipe is squisito and quick! I have always wanted to make pasta, but my thinking lead me to believe that it would be too complicated - not so with this recipe. I did not change anything, and the pasta came out great! I served the Gnocchi with jalape√±o applewood bacon, saut√©ed asparagus all in a light garlic sauce. 
A few days later, I tried the same recipe for chicken and dumplings. The only thing I did differently was I rolled the pasta in quarter to half-inch thickness. Using a pizza cutter, I cut the pasta in two-inch strips then boiled these strips in homemade chicken broth. We absolutely loved it!

Turned out really good! I had 2 cups of mashed potatoes mixed with the egg and only had to use 2 cups of flour to get the right consistency. I need to get a little better at cutting them to more consistent sizes and getting the grooves, but for my first time making gnocchi by scratch I am super happy with the result.
Who knew it was that easy!!! My husband loved them

Made this a about dozen times now. Very good recipe. I find that using one pound of potatoes to two cups flour is ideal. One pound comes out to normally one large baking potato. If you add maybe an extra ounce of flour you can also achieve a nice fairly fluffy gnocchi. I find unbleached organic flour works really well for these as well.
